Sanders: claim about the top 1 percent earning 85 percent of all new income is largely accurate.
The claim was previously rated as Mostly: as Sanders' figure was credible but not the only way to consider income inequality.
According to economist Emmanuel Saez: the top 1 percent captured 91 percent of pre-tax, pre-transfer income from 2009 to 2012.
